questions.question_text: Which one of the following statements about viewpoints is correct?

choices.C: A viewpoint is used as a template to create a view
choices.B: A viewpoint is used to create views in Phases E and F
choices.D: A viewpoint is what a stakeholder sees
choices.A: A viewpoint is always specific to an architecture

discussion.content:
Correct answer is C:
A viewpoint defines the perspective from which a view is taken. More specifically, a viewpoint defines: how to construct and use a view (by means of an appropriate schema or template); the information that should appear in the view; the modeling techniques for expressing and analyzing the information; and a rationale for these choices (e.g., by describing the purpose and intended audience of the view).

The correct statement about viewpoints is:

C. A viewpoint is used as a template to create a view.

A viewpoint in architecture represents a perspective or viewpoint from which a specific set of concerns or interests of stakeholders can be addressed. It defines the conventions, rules, and languages for creating architectural views that capture and communicate the relevant information to those stakeholders. A viewpoint provides a framework or template that guides the creation of views, which are visual representations or descriptions of specific aspects of the architecture. These views are then used to communicate and analyze the architecture from the intended perspective.

I would say answer D.
Togaf book states: An architecture viewpoint is a model (or description) of the information contained in a view. In our example, one architecture viewpoint is the description of how the pilot sees the system, and the other architecture viewpoint is how the controller sees the system

comments.content: Stakeholder doesn't see the viewpoint, but the view which is produced out of that viewpoint

questions.question_text: Which one of the following describes classification methods for architecture and solution artifacts within the Architecture Repository?

discussion.content: enterprise Continuum classifies the assets it is a view on Architecture repository. So C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
Why the other options are not correct:

Architecture Landscape: A strategic view of the current and future state of the enterprise architecture, but it doesn't provide classification methods for artifacts.
Architecture Vision: A high-level statement of the desired future state of the architecture, not a classification system.
Governance Log: A record of governance decisions and activities, not related to artifact classification.
Standards Information Base: A repository of relevant standards, not a classification system itself.

Selected Answer: C
n the context of TOGAF, the Enterprise Continuum is a way to classify architecture and solution artifacts as they evolve from generic Foundation Architectures to Organization-Specific Architectures. This continuum provides a method for classifying all the architecture and solution artifacts, both internal and external to the enterprise, that exist at different levels of abstraction.
